title: Unhelpful error message in case of misformed token
body:
Summary:
```
$ git diff
diff --git a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/libtool/package.py b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/libtool/package.py
index 98be32a60..1d3ef4735 100644
--- a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/libtool/package.py
+++ b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/libtool/package.py
@@ -34,7 +34,7 @@ class Libtool(AutotoolsPackage):
     version('2.4.6', 'addf44b646ddb4e3919805aa88fa7c5e')
     version('2.4.2', 'd2f3b7d4627e69e13514a40e72a24d50')
 
-    depends_on('m4@1.4.6:', type='build')
+    depends_on('m4@:1.4.6:', type='build')
 
     build_directory = 'spack-build'
 
$ spack info libtool
==> Error: Unexpected token
```

### Expected Result

An error helping me find out where the typo is in the `package.py`

I went down (or more precisely tried to go down) the rabbit hole of `spec.py`, `parse.py` and `error.py` but still don't completely understand how the error handling there is supposed to happen. When I do a 
```
$ spack -d info libtool
```
I even get a 
```
During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
```

I have a stop-gap measure that at least prints the token where the error occurs in #7730, but I didn't find a way to add the file that was being handled to the output. Still with `grep` and some searching I guess the user can now find the error... 

This should probably be cleaned up in a more comprehensive way though (especially the "exception while handling an exception" part).
